description: Main dashboard functionality including technician management, customer queue, and dashboard state

components.DashboardStore: The abstract class with the MobX store logic. It manages the state for technicians, tickets in the queue, upcoming appointments, and various UI settings.

rules: loadDashboardData is the main entry point for loading all dashboard data.
It loads settings from SettingsManager first.
It initializes and uses DriftEmployeeRepository, DriftTicketRepository, and DriftAppointmentRepository to fetch data from the database.
loadDataFromDatabase fetches technicians, queue tickets, and today's appointments.
Technician status (available, busy, assigned) is calculated based on the tickets assigned to them.
A technician is considered 'off' based on their isClockedIn status from the employee table.
Uses MobX observables (@observable) for reactive state.
Uses computed properties (@computed) to derive state, like filteredTechnicians and filteredQueueTickets.
Uses actions (@action) to modify the state.
The technician list can be filtered by status (All, Available, Busy).
The technician list can be sorted by Turn, Name, or Status.
The customer queue can be filtered by All, Walk In, Appointment, or Completed.
assignTechnician: Assigns a technician to a ticket in the database and reloads the data.
checkInCustomer: Changes a ticket's status to 'in-service'.
addTicketToQueue: Adds a new ticket to the database.
updateTicket: Updates an existing ticket.
checkInAppointment: Checks in a customer from an appointment, which should ideally create a new ticket.
checkAutoAssignments is a key business logic feature.
It finds eligible technicians (available or assigned but just clocked in).
For each eligible technician, it finds the highest priority ticket for them.
A walk-in who has waited 15+ minutes takes priority over an appointment.
Appointments take priority over walk-ins (if the walk-in hasn't waited long).
If the type is the same, the oldest ticket (by check-in time) has priority.
startAutoAssignmentMonitoring sets up a MobX reaction to automatically trigger the check when relevant data (like the queue or technician status) changes.
Manages settings like font size, layout modes, and whether to show certain panels (schedule, appointments). These settings are persisted via SettingsService and SettingsManager.

components.TechnicianCard: A StatefulWidget that displays information about a technician, including their name, clock-in status, and assigned ticket. It allows for clocking in/out and changing PIN.

components._TechnicianCardState: The state for TechnicianCard. It handles loading the technician's clock-in status, toggling clock-in/out, showing snack bars, and displaying a PIN change menu.

rules: A technician's clock-in status is loaded when the card is initialized.
Clocking in or out requires a PIN, handled by TimeTrackingService.
After clocking in/out, the dashboard data is refreshed to reflect the change in technician availability.
After clocking in, an auto-assignment check is triggered.
A long press on the technician's avatar opens a menu for changing their PIN.
The technician's status color changes based on their availability and clock-in status (`available`, `busy`, `break`, `clocked-out`).
The display of technician specializations (icons or pills) is controlled by a setting from SettingsStore.
Tapping the card opens the TicketDetailsDialog if a ticket is assigned, otherwise it triggers the onAssignCustomer callback if the technician is available.
Technician specializations are currently hardcoded based on name, but intended to be loaded from the employee_service_categories table.

components.CustomerQueueCard: A StatelessWidget that displays a customer ticket in the queue as a card with relevant information including wait time, services, and technician assignment.

rules: The card displays a colored left border that changes based on ticket type and wait time using AppColors.getQueueBorderColor.
Shows customer name with a circle indicator (blue for walk-ins, purple for appointments).
Displays group size indicator if it's a group service.
Shows wait time in minutes with color coding: red for >40min, orange for >20min, normal for <20min.
Shows check-in time in 12-hour format with am/pm.
Services are displayed as either pills or icons based on SettingsStore.serviceDisplayMode setting.
Only shows first 3 services with a '+X more' indicator if there are additional services.
For group services, shows '+X more' indicator for additional group members.
Bottom section shows technician assignment and ticket type (Walk-in/Appt) with appropriate icons.

Technician display logic: shows 'Tech: Multiple technicians' for groups, requested technician name if available, looks up assigned technician by ID, shows 'Tech: Assigned' if ID exists but technician not found, or 'Tech: Any' if no assignment.
Card is tappable with onTap callback.
Uses Material design with InkWell for tap effects and box shadow for elevation.

components.ServiceSelectionView: A StatelessWidget that provides the UI for selecting services and managing ticket status when editing existing tickets.

rules: Shows status selection chips (queued, in-service, completed, cancelled) only when editing existing tickets (not for new check-ins).
Provides a toggle switch for enabling/disabling group service mode.
Displays service selection for the primary customer and additional group members if group service is enabled.
Each member section shows their type (adult/child) and allows adding/removing services.
Services are displayed with price, duration, and technician assignment status.
Technician assignment shows green indicator when assigned, orange when unassigned.
Provides buttons to add adult or child group members.
Service selection dialog includes search functionality and category filtering.
Service categories are displayed with color coding and service counts.
Technician selection dialog shows available technicians first, with availability status indicators.
Uses MobX Observer pattern for reactive UI updates.
Status chips are color-coded: completed (green), in-service (orange), queued (blue), cancelled (red).

components.CheckInDialog: A StatefulWidget that provides the initial check-in interface for both walk-ins and appointments.

components.CheckInType: An enum defining the two types of check-ins: walkIn and appointment.

rules: Supports two check-in types: Walk In and Appointment, selected via toggle pills.
Can be pre-populated with an appointment for direct appointment check-in.
For walk-ins, uses CustomerSearchWidget to select or search for customers.
For appointments, loads and displays today's available appointments from AppointmentsStore.
Converts appointments to ticket format for compatibility with the ticket system.
Loads available technicians from DriftEmployeeRepository and converts them to Technician objects.
Loads available services from DriftServiceRepository for the ticket details dialog.
Upon successful check-in selection, opens TicketDetailsDialog with the appropriate data.
Validates that technicians are loaded before allowing check-in to proceed.
Handles loading states for appointments and technicians with appropriate UI indicators.
Shows appointment time, customer info, and status for appointment selections.
Check-in button is disabled until valid selection is made and technicians are loaded.
Uses AppointmentsStore to get filtered available appointments (not already checked in).
Error handling with ErrorLogger for failed data loading operations.

components.GroupMember: A helper class to represent a group member with name and type (adult/child).

components.GroupMemberWidget: A StatefulWidget for managing group service members and their individual service selections.

components._AddGroupMemberDialog: A dialog for adding new group members with custom names.

rules: Supports adding both adult and child group members to service tickets.
Auto-generates member names (Adult 1, Adult 2, Child 1, etc.) when using quick add buttons.
Each group member has their own ServiceSelectionWidget for individual service management.
Member cards display type indicators with color coding: blue for adults, green for children.
Provides remove member functionality with confirmation.
Services are managed per member through separate service selection interfaces.
Group member names can be customized through the add dialog.
Visual hierarchy shows member type badges and member-specific service selections.
Integrates with parent widget callbacks for member and service management.
Uses Material Design cards with shadows and proper spacing for member display.

components.ServiceSelection: A helper class to track service and technician assignment pairs.

components.ServiceSelectionWidget: A StatefulWidget for selecting services and assigning technicians with category filtering.

rules: Provides category-based filtering with color-coded filter chips showing service counts.
Services are displayed in a responsive grid layout with availability indicators.
Supports automatic technician assignment when first technician is selected.
Smart technician assignment: first selected technician is auto-assigned to compatible services.
Selected services show technician assignment status with visual indicators (green=assigned, orange=unassigned).
Technician selection dialog shows availability status and sorted by availability/turn number.
Prevents duplicate service selection for the same member.
Service buttons are disabled once selected and show check marks.
Category filtering includes 'All' option and individual category chips with service counts.
Reassign technician functionality available for all selected services.
Service items display price, duration, category pills, and assignment status.
Technician selection shows avatar, name, availability status, and turn information.
Auto-assignment logic checks technician capability compatibility (simplified for now).
Service grid adapts based on available services and category filters.
Provides remove service functionality with confirmation.

components.ServiceSelection: A helper class to track service and technician assignment pairs within the dialog.

components._DialogState: Enhanced dialog state management class with full ticket creation/editing functionality.

components.SimplifiedTicketDetailsDialog: A comprehensive StatefulWidget for creating and editing tickets with full functionality.

rules: Supports both new check-in creation and existing ticket editing modes.
Dual-column layout: left for customer/services (75%), right for assignment/payment (25%).
Walk-in vs Appointment toggle in header with different workflows for each type.
Customer search functionality with autocomplete and creation of new customers.
Adult customer option for walk-ins who prefer not to provide personal information.
Service selection with category filtering and technician assignment per service.
Group service support with individual member service selections.
Primary technician assignment functionality in right sidebar.
Real-time payment calculation with subtotal, tax (8.75%), and total display.
Validation rules: services required, customer required for walk-ins, appointment required for appointments.
Customer search integrates with DriftCustomerRepository for database searches.
Service assignment shows visual status indicators (assigned/unassigned technicians).
Group members can be added as adults or children with individual service selections.
Technician selection dialog shows availability, turn numbers, and compatibility.
Appointment integration loads today's appointments for check-in.
State management preserves all selections during dialog lifecycle.
Confirmation flow creates complete ticket with all services and assignments.
Error handling for customer search and data loading operations.

components.DashboardScreen: Main dashboard StatefulWidget providing operations dashboard with technician status, customer queue, and appointment management.

components._DashboardScreenState: Dashboard state managing auto-assignment monitoring, ticket dialogs, and check-in workflows.

components._TechnicianListItem: Compact list item widget for technicians in single column mode with avatar, status, and assignment details.

components._CustomerQueueListItem: Compact list item widget for customer queue tickets in single column mode with wait time and service display.

rules: Main operations dashboard with header containing navigation buttons: Calendar, New Check-in, Checkout, and Register.
Dynamic layout supports different grid configurations (single, grid2, grid3) based on settings.
Technician section with filtering (All, Available, Busy) and sorting (Turn, Name, Status) capabilities.
Customer queue section with filtering (All, Walk In, Appointment) and dynamic display modes.
Optional Today's Schedule timeline section that can be toggled and expanded/collapsed.
Optional Upcoming Appointments section showing next appointments with check-in and contact actions.
Auto-assignment monitoring starts on widget initialization for automatic technician assignment.
Check-in dialog integration supporting both walk-in and appointment check-ins.
Appointment check-in converts appointments to tickets and updates appointment status.
Auto-assignment logic attempts to assign tickets to available requested technicians.
Technician grid supports 1, 2, or 3 column layouts with different aspect ratios.
Customer queue grid supports same layout flexibility with appropriate card sizing.
Real-time filtering and sorting of technicians based on status and turn numbers.
Queue filtering supports type-based filtering (walk-in vs appointment).
Ticket details dialog integration for editing existing tickets and assigning technicians.
Service display modes support both service pills and category icons based on settings.
Wait time color coding: normal (<20min), orange (>20min), red (>40min).
Cache coordination notifications for cross-screen data updates.
Success notifications for completed check-ins and appointments.
Responsive layout adjusts column flex ratios based on upcoming appointments visibility.
Debug logging for auto-assignment operations and technician status tracking.
Error handling for repository operations and dialog workflows.
Time formatting utilities for appointment and check-in time display.
Status-based color coding for technician avatars and customer queue borders.
Turn number display and management for technician rotation.

components.ServiceSelection: Helper class tracking service and technician assignment pairs for dialog state management.

components.ServiceSelectionWidget: Comprehensive StatefulWidget for service selection with category filtering, technician assignment, and service management.

components._ServiceSelectionWidgetState: State management for service selection with auto-assignment logic and technician compatibility checking.

rules: Service selection with category-based filtering using ServiceCategories configuration.
Technician assignment with compatibility checking and auto-assignment logic.
Category filter chips with count display and color-coded visual indicators.
Service grid layout with 2-column responsive design and proper aspect ratios.
Selected services display with technician assignment status and reassignment options.
First technician assignment tracking for automatic assignment to compatible services.
Technician selection dialog with availability status, turn numbers, and visual indicators.
Service button styling with selection states, check marks, and category pills.
Auto-assignment workflow: first service requires technician selection, subsequent services auto-assign when compatible.
Technician compatibility checking with fallback to manual selection for incompatible services.
Category grouping with service count display and proper empty state handling.
Service removal functionality with callback integration for parent state management.
Visual feedback for assigned vs unassigned technicians with proper color coding.
Dialog-based technician selection with avatar display, availability status, and turn indicators.
Service item display with category pills, pricing, duration, and technician assignment status.
Reassignment functionality with dialog integration for changing technician assignments.
Professional service cards with pricing display, category indicators, and selection states.
Filter chip interface with selected states, count badges, and category color theming.
Grid-based service layout with proper spacing, borders, and hover states.
Callback pattern for service addition, removal, and technician assignment events.
Material Design components with consistent theming and accessibility support.
Error handling for technician availability and service compatibility edge cases.
Snackbar notifications for user feedback on assignment failures and conflicts.
State synchronization between selected services and technician assignments across dialog lifecycle.

components.TicketActionsWidget: StatelessWidget providing context-aware action buttons for ticket operations based on ticket status and dialog mode.

components.EmbeddedTicketSummaryWidget: StatelessWidget displaying payment summary with service breakdown, tax calculations, and group service information.

rules: Context-aware action buttons based on ticket status: in-service, completed, paid states.
Primary action button with dynamic text and color based on current ticket state.
Secondary actions for existing tickets: mark complete, begin checkout based on status.
Confirmation dialogs for critical actions: mark complete, begin checkout with proper styling.
Checkout prompt workflow: automatic prompt after marking service complete.
Button state management with proper enabled/disabled states based on form validation.
Color-coded action buttons: success green for completion, primary blue for checkout and check-in.
Payment summary integration with subtotal, tax (8.75%), and total calculations.
Group service support with member count display and multi-member service totals.
Service count aggregation across primary customer and all group members.
Responsive button layout with proper flex ratios and spacing.
Dialog integration for action confirmations with cancel and proceed options.
Embedded ticket summary with service breakdown, tax display, and total highlighting.
Group size information display with member count and service distribution.
Professional styling with proper padding, borders, and visual hierarchy.
Callback pattern for action handling: onConfirm, onMarkComplete, onBeginCheckout, onShowCheckout.
Status-based button text: Check In Customer, Mark Complete, Begin Checkout, View Receipt, Save Changes.
Auto-checkout prompt after service completion with delayed dialog presentation.
Tax calculation integration with configurable tax rate (8.75% default).
Service summary display with proper formatting and member service aggregation.
Material Design dialog components with consistent button styling and layout.
Error prevention with confirmation dialogs for irreversible actions.
Professional color theming with status-appropriate button colors.
Future-delayed interactions for smooth UX flow between action confirmations.

components.TicketSummaryWidget: StatelessWidget providing comprehensive payment summary display with service breakdown, tax calculations, and group service support.

rules: Comprehensive payment summary with subtotal, tax (8.75%), and total calculations.
Service breakdown display for primary services and group member services.
Group service support with member-specific service listings and totals.
Real-time calculation properties: subtotal, tax, and total as computed getters.
Empty state handling with appropriate messaging for no selected services.
Service list organization by member with clear section headers and service details.
Technician assignment display with small badge integration for assigned services.
Professional payment summary styling with receipt icon and clear typography.
Tax calculation with configurable rate (8.75%) and proper decimal formatting.
Total highlighting with primary blue theming and emphasized styling.
Group size information display with person/people pluralization logic.
Service pricing display with consistent currency formatting to two decimal places.
Member service sections with conditional rendering based on service availability.
Divider integration for visual separation between service breakdown and totals.
Responsive container design with proper padding, borders, and background colors.
Service name display with overflow handling and technician badge integration.
Primary blue accent for total amount with enhanced visual prominence.
Consistent spacing and typography throughout payment summary sections.
Professional styling with card-based layout and proper visual hierarchy.
Service count aggregation across all members for comprehensive summary display.
Clean section organization with proper headers for different service categories.
Badge-style technician display with color coding and compact formatting.
Conditional content rendering based on service selection state and group configuration.
Material Design principles with consistent theming and accessibility considerations.

components.AppointmentSelectionWidget: A comprehensive StatefulWidget for selecting check-in type and managing appointment-based check-ins with service pre-population.

components._AppointmentSelectionWidgetState: State management for appointment selection with check-in type toggling and appointment filtering.

rules: Dual check-in type support: Walk-in and Appointment with visual toggle pills.
Check-in type pills with color coding: success green for walk-in, primary blue for appointment.
Today's appointments list with customer information, timing, and service details.
Appointment selection with visual selection states and toggle functionality.
Service pre-population: automatically loads appointment services when selected.
Customer avatar generation using first letter of customer name with status color coding.
Appointment status display with color-coded badges: scheduled, arrived, in-service, completed.
Status color mapping: primary blue (scheduled), success green (arrived/completed), warning orange (in-service).
Service count display with pluralization logic for proper grammar.
Requested technician display with primary blue highlighting for visibility.
Price calculation and display for appointment services with proper currency formatting.
Empty state handling with helpful messaging for days without appointments.
Selection state management with null toggle support for deselection.
Appointment time formatting using AppDateFormatter for consistent time display.
ListTile integration with proper padding and visual hierarchy.
Material Design card styling with borders and selection highlighting.
Customer information display: name, scheduled time, service count, technician preference.
Trailing section with status badge and price information for quick reference.
Callback integration for check-in type changes, appointment selection, and service pre-population.
Professional styling with consistent spacing, colors, and typography.
Responsive design with proper touch targets and accessibility support.
Error-resistant design with null safety and graceful handling of missing data.

components.GroupMember: Helper class representing a group member with name and type (adult/child) properties.

components.GroupMemberWidget: A comprehensive StatefulWidget for managing group service members with individual service selections.

components._GroupMemberWidgetState: State management for group member operations with automatic naming and service integration.

components._AddGroupMemberDialog: Dialog widget for adding new group members with name input and type-based styling.

components._AddGroupMemberDialogState: State management for member creation dialog with validation and submission handling.

rules: Group member management with support for both adult and child member types.
Individual service selection for each group member using ServiceSelectionWidget integration.
Auto-generated member names with incremental numbering: Adult 1, Adult 2, Child 1, Child 2.
Member type color coding: primary blue for adults, success green for children.
Group member cards with elevated styling, shadows, and professional appearance.
Service selection integration: each member gets full service selection capabilities.
Member removal functionality with close button integration.
Add member buttons with type-specific styling and icons: person_add for adults, child_care for children.
Callback pattern for member operations: onMemberAdded, onMemberRemoved, onServiceAdded, onServiceRemoved, onTechnicianAssigned.
ServiceSelection integration for technician assignment and service management per member.
Professional card design with proper padding, borders, and visual hierarchy.
Member header with type badge and name display for clear identification.
Dynamic service management: each member maintains their own service list.
Member name generation logic with type-based counting for unique identification.
Dialog-based member addition with name input, validation, and type-specific theming.
Material Design principles with consistent button styling and layout.
Group service aggregation support for comprehensive service and pricing calculations.
Visual distinction between member types with appropriate color schemes.
Responsive design with proper spacing and touch-friendly interface elements.
Error handling and validation for member creation and service assignment operations.
